title: George Avery Young
text:
George Avery Young (June 1866 – 21 January 1900) was an <a href="England">English</a>-born sportsman who played international <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> for <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Wales</a> and cricket for <a href="Glamorgan%20County%20Cricket%20Club">Glamorgan</a>.
Rugby career.
Although born in Tynemouth in the North of England, Young moved to Wales where he came to note as a sportsman. His first major club was <a href="Cardiff%20RFC">Cardiff</a>, and while playing with the Blue and Blacks he was selected to represent Wales in the country's opening game of the <a href="1886%20Home%20Nations%20Championship">1886 Home Nations Championship</a>, against England. Under the captaincy of <a href="Charlie%20Newman">Charlie Newman</a>, Young was one of five Cardiff players to represent Wales on the day, with teammates <a href="Billy%20Douglas%20%28rugby%20player%29">Billy Douglas</a> and <a href="Dai%20Lewis">Dai Lewis</a> joining Young as first caps. His second and final cap was the next game of the 1886 Championship, this time against Scotland, which Wales again lost.
During the 1886/87 season, Young was given the captaincy of Cardiff, which he held for two seasons.
International games played.
Wales
